description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ’Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for the business’s trading status.
This section asks for information about:

list: changes to your business’s turnover in the last month
current challenges impacting your business’s turnover
expectations for turnover in the next month
demand for goods and services over the last month

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: prices of goods or services bought or sold over the last month
expectations for goods or services sold for the next month
factors causing your business to consider raising prices

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business’s stockpiling and stock levels.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
global supply chain disruption

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: exporting or importing of goods or services
exporting and importing challenges

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: changes to number of employees
worker shortages
difficulties with recruitment

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: the main concern for your business
business’s overall performance

contents.description: The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

blocks.page_title: Trading status of your business section

contents.description: This section asks for the business’s trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}’s trading status?

description:
You can interpret ’trading’ as ’operating’.

Only select ’paused trading’ if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: changes to your business’s turnover in the last month
current challenges impacting your business’s turnover
expectations for turnover in the next month
demand for goods and services over the last month

title.text: How did {ru_name}’s turnover in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

question.title: Which of the following challenges, if any, are currently impacting your business’s turnover?

options.label: Competition
options.description: This includes competitive imports and competition within your sector

options.label: Financial costs
options.description: This includes interest rates and access to bank credit

question.title: What are your business’s expectations for turnover in March 2025?
description: When considering expectations, compare to your business’s current turnover.

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same

question.title: How did your business’s domestic demand for goods and services in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s domestic order book

contents.description: Exclude:

list: seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Domestic demand for goods and services

question.title: How did your business’s international demand for goods and services in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s export order book

contents.description: Exclude:

list: seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: International demand for goods and services

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: prices of goods or services bought or sold over the last month
expectations for goods or services sold for the next month
factors causing your business to consider raising prices

title.text: How did the prices of goods or services bought by {ru_name} in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Prices of goods or services bought

question.title: How did the prices of goods or services sold by your business in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Prices of goods or services sold

question.title: What are your business’s expectations for the prices of goods or services sold in March 2025?
description: When considering expectations, compare to your business’s current prices of goods or services.

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Expectations for prices of goods or services sold

question.title: Which of the following factors, if any, are causing your business to consider raising prices in March 2025?

options.label: Finance costs
options.description: For example, commissions, fees and interest rates

options.label: Business is not considering raising prices

blocks.page_title: Factors causing business to consider raising prices

contents.description: This section asks for information about your business’s stockpiling and stock levels.

title.text: Is {ru_name} stockpiling any goods or materials?

question.title: How did your business’s stock levels of raw materials in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: work in progress

contents.description: Exclude:

list: seasonal changes

contents.description: This refers to the basic input goods that your business requires to manufacture its products.

question.title: How did your business’s stock levels of finished goods in January 2025 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: goods for resale

contents.description: Exclude:

list: seasonal changes
work in progress

contents.description: This refers to goods that have completed the manufacturing process and are ready for sale.
This section asks for information about:

list: the availability of materials, goods and services within the UK
global supply chain disruption

title.text: Was {ru_name} able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from within the UK in January 2025?

options.label: Yes, the business was able to get the materials, goods or services it needed
Yes, but the business had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
No, the business was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed

blocks.page_title: Materials, goods or services from within the UK

question.title: Did your business experience any global supply chain disruption in January 2025?

definitions.title: Examples of global supply chain disruption

list: cross-border frictions
disruption to prices
lack of HGV drivers
raw material shortages

question.title: What was the main reason for global supply chain disruption?

options.label: Conflict in the Middle East
options.description: For example, the Suez Canal, Red Sea and Strait of Hormuz regions

options.label: Severe weather or climate event
options.description: For example, a storm, heatwave or flooding

options.label: Other transportation issues
options.description: For example, transportation costs or delays

blocks.page_title: Main reason for global supply chain disruption

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: exporting or importing of goods or services
exporting and importing challenges

title.text: Did {ru_name} export or import any goods or services in January 2025?

definitions.title: What we mean by ’goods or services’

contents.description: ’Goods’ refers to physical or digital items sold to customers. These can be final or intermediate products.

’Services’ refers to a customer paying your business to perform tasks, provide advice or for experiences, rather than for products. This includes delivering services virtually, by travelling to them, or by having them travel to the UK.

options.label: Business did not export or import

question.title: Did your business experience an increase in any of the following exporting challenges in January 2025, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced more additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules of origin certifications

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
Difficulty finding information on how to export
Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
Did not experience an increase in any exporting challenges

question.title: Did your business experience an increase in any of the following importing challenges in January 2025, compared with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: For example, a business experienced more additional paperwork compared to the previous calendar month.

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules of origin certifications

options.label: Difficulty finding information on how to import
Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Did not experience an increase in any importing challenges

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: changes to number of employees
worker shortages
difficulties with recruitment

title.text: What are {ru_name}’s expectations for the number of employees in March 2025?

description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

When considering expectations, compare to your business’s current number of employees.

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

options.label: Number of employees will stay the same

blocks.page_title: Expectations for business’s number of employees

question.title: Is your business currently experiencing a shortage of workers?
Did your business experience any difficulties recruiting employees in January 2025?

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: the main concern for your business
business’s overall performance

question.title: Which of the following, if any, will be the main concern for your business in March 2025?

options.label: Falling demand of goods and services
Inflation of goods and services prices

question.title: How would you describe your business’s overall performance in January 2025, compared with the same calendar month last year?
description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.

question.title: How do you expect your business’s overall performance to change over the next 12 months?
description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.

question.title: Please tell us anything else about your business’s current situation relating to topics covered in this survey

contents.description: You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select submit at the bottom.
Your response will help inform decision-makers how best to support the UK population and economy.
Learn more about how we use this data (this link opens in a new tab)

submission.title: Check your answers and submit
submission.warning: You must submit this survey to complete it
submission.guidance: You will have the opportunity to view, save or print a copy of your answers after submitting this survey.
